intro: Pilosella subpubens, commonly known as the hairy whitlow grass, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features small, yellow to whitish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are hairy and often covered with a fine pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella subpubens thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
